definition: to fall back/to go in reverse
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: No such thing as a back-flow of ideas exists any more than there exists a return of a river on its course.
sentences.chinese: 思想並不比江河有更多倒退的餘地。

sentences.english: Actually, let me back up and do this in video.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，讓我們倒退下然後在錄像裏做這個。

sentences.english: How long does it last before the tumours regresses?
sentences.chinese: 多久前的腫瘤去年倒退？

sentences.english: This is not countermarch or backslide.
Affirm that no matter what you will not backslide into your old bad habit patterns.
sentences.chinese: 申明無論怎樣你不會倒退到舊惡習貴模式。

sentences.english: Could it reverse a two-decade decline in economic and social progress?
sentences.chinese: 它是否能夠扭轉歷時二十年的經濟和社會倒退？

sentences.english: Time of rapid retrogression in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 時間飛速的在我的腦中倒退。

sentences.english: "We'd be years behind where we are now without these individuals, " says Humes.
sentences.chinese: 修姆說，“如果沒有這些人，我們可能倒退很多年。”

sentences.english: His white car reversed through the school gate.
sentences.chinese: 他的白色汽車通過校門倒退進去。

sentences.english: At first glance, it seems a retrogression of social civilization.
sentences.chinese: 乍一看，這似乎是一個社會文明的倒退。

sentences.english: The horse snorted  and shied at the train.
sentences.chinese: 那匹馬被火車嚇得直噴鼻連連倒退。

sentences.english: The Bicycle got in the way of the Backing car.
sentences.chinese: 自行車擋到要倒退的車。

sentences.english: The reactionary elements attempt to set back the clock of history. They're doomed to failure.
sentences.chinese: 反動分子企圖使歷史倒退，他們是註定要失敗的。

sentences.english: The car has four forward gears and one reverse gear.
sentences.chinese: 這輛車有四個前進檔和一個倒退檔。

sentences.english: The horse shied at the loud noise.
sentences.chinese: 那馬聽到巨大的響聲時驚得往後倒退。

sentences.english: Some say the regressive lurch occurred because Americans lost confidence in government.
sentences.chinese: 有人說倒退的慘敗是因爲美國人失去了對政府的信任。

definition: to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
to do less well than before/to make a concession/setback/backward step/leeway/room to maneuver/fallback
stagnation/at a standstill/bogged down
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
flying speed/rapid (growth)
from now on/in the future/time to come
hurried/at a great speed/rapid (development)
to move forwards
forward/onward
to come to a stand/to stop
backwards/facing back
(physics) inertia/(fig.) force of habit/tendency to do things in the accustomed way/habitual
to decline/to fall/to drop/to falter/a decline/recession (in economics)
to roll/to turn over/to invert/to flip
to fall/to drop
tottering/on the verge of collapse
